name: Wilfa Svart Pour Over immersion recipe by Tim Wendelboe
short_description: Immersive recipe for Wilfa Svart Pour Over by Tim Wendelboe, Tim Wendelboe, World Barista Champion and World Cup Tasters Champion. Tim partnered with Wilfa to create this dripper.

steps.description: Rinse filter and brewer with hot water. Grind your coffee. Pour in grounds, zero out the scales. Close the flow restrictor.
Pour in <final_water_amount>g. of water
Swirl the brewer a little.
Let the coffee steep.
Gently break the coffee crust with a spoon.
Wait a little more.
Fully open the flow control, wait for the complete drawdown.

name: Wilfa Svart Pour Over pour over recipe by Best Coffee
short_description: Another method of brewing with Wilfa Svart Pour Over is, you guessed it, pour over! This is a recipe by [Best Coffee](https://www.bestcoffee.guide/blogs/product-reviews/wilfa-pour-over-smart-dripper-review).

steps.description: Rinse filter and brewer with hot water. Grind your coffee. Pour in grounds, zero out the scales. Close the flow restrictor.
Pre-wet with (2.2 x <final_coffee_amount>)g of water.
Let the coffee bloom.
Open the flow control to the halfway point.
Add water up to (0.6 x <final_water_amount>)g.
Continue to add water until you reach <final_water_amount>g.
Wait for the complete drawdown and close the the flow control.

name: Wilfa Svart Pour Over Iced recipe (James Hoffmann)
short_description: This recipe uses an improved immersion iced coffee technique by James Hoffman. Check the the [tutorial here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8uGGeV8A-BM). Optional: you can add a few drops of saline (a solution of 20% salt and 80% water) in the end to reduce the bitterness. Note: you need to grind finer than you normally do for pour over, but not espresso-fine.

steps.description: Insert the paper filter into Wilfa Svart Pour Over and rinse it with water. Grind the coffee, but don't put into brewer yet. Place on scale and zero it out. Get a spoon. You'll need (0.34 x <final_water_amount>)g of ice, but keep it in the freezer for now.
Add (0.66 x <final_water_amount>)g. of water to the brewer
Put the coffee in the water and stir it with a spoon, making sure that all the coffee is wet.
Let the coffee steep. When the steep time is almost over, place (0.34 x <final_water_amount>)g of ice into the server.
Place the brewer on a server and wait for the complete drawdown.
Swirl the server or stir with a spoon to dilute the remaining ice. Optional: add a few drops of saline to reduce bitterness.
